recommendations.title: PAN 2.0 to Go Live in 18 Months: What It Means and How It Affects You
recommendations.excerpt: The Rs 1,435 crore project will focus on simplifying taxpayer registration services and improving the overall experience through a new, unified online platform.

recommendations.title: The Best Honeymoon Destinations, From the Namib Desert to the Amalfi Coast
recommendations.excerpt: Searching for the best honeymoon destinations or honeymoon hotels? There’s certainly no one-size-fits-all-couples getaway—but there are several fantastic five-star resorts across the world known for their romantic, once-in-a-lifetime appeal.

recommendations.title: What Happens If Every Light in the World Is Switched on at Once?
recommendations.excerpt: The biggest effect of everyone turning lights on at once would be a surge in demand for electricity, which most people worldwide use to operate their lights. Electricity is a form of energy that is made using many different fuels.

recommendations.title: School Fee Vs Salary: Why Parents Are Feeling the Squeeze Like Never Before
recommendations.excerpt: Private school fees in Indian metros are rising sharply, far exceeding salary increases. This trend is causing financial stress for parents and sparking protests amid weak regulatory enforcement.

recommendations.title: Four Dead As Flash Flood Causes Mudslide in Indian Town of Dharali
recommendations.excerpt: Large-scale search and rescue operation under way after at least four people killed in Himalayan region

recommendations.excerpt: India's performance improved significantly under Shubman Gill, culminating in a thrilling final Test win at the Oval.

recommendations.title: Signs You Need to Rebalance Your Nervous System
recommendations.excerpt: In a culture in which everything feels urgent, social media is filled with bad news, and our work days feel endless, something’s bound to give. Often, that thing is our nervous systems.

recommendations.title: What to Know About India’s Trade in Oil With Russia
recommendations.excerpt: For months, Indian and American trade officials haggled over things like tariffs and import quotas, trying to work out an agreement both sides could live with. President Trump, intent on closing a $44 billion trade deficit with India, threatened to impose tariffs on Indian goods sent to America.

recommendations.title: Gaza Latest: ‘We’re Trying to Get Gazans Fed’, Says Trump; UN ‘Deeply Alarmed’ by Report Israel Plans ‘Full Occupation’
recommendations.excerpt: Benjamin Netanyahu is reportedly seeking cabinet approval to fully occupy Gaza - an idea that "deeply alarms" the UN. Donald Trump dodged a question on that report, but did say they want to "get people fed" in the territory.

recommendations.title: After My Father Died, I Began Cooking for My Mother the Same Dishes She Once Made for Him

recommendations.excerpt: At Chobe Game Lodge in Botswana, one safari guide team is changing the narrative around a woman’s role in conservation and tourism in Africa.

recommendations.title: NRI Health Insurance Surges 150%: Why More Choose Treatment in India
recommendations.excerpt: More non-resident Indians (NRIs) are looking to India for health insurance and medical care, with a 150 per cent year-on-year surge in overall NRI health insurance adoption, according to PolicyBazaar.

recommendations.excerpt: The book outlines the rivalry between Carl Linnaeus and Georges-Louis LeClerc due to their differing intellectual approaches to understanding natural history.

recommendations.title: These Creatives Moved to Europe and Designed a Better Life and Career. Should You?
recommendations.excerpt: Thinking of leaving the United States for life abroad? You’re not alone. A record-setting 21% of Americans expressed a desire to emigrate in 2024. While politics might play a role in the uptick, an increasing number of creative professionals are also leaving for career reasons.
